themes.scientific_basis: Based on religious tolerance research and studies on interfaith relationship dynamics
themes.description: Evaluates how partners demonstrate respect for each other's religious beliefs and practices, including the ability to discuss faith without judgment

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in cultural psychology research and studies on religious ritual participation in relationships
themes.description: Assesses how couples navigate participation in each other's religious rituals and celebrations while maintaining authenticity

themes.scientific_basis: Based on research on moral foundations theory and religious value integration in relationships
themes.description: Measures how effectively partners identify common values across different religious backgrounds and build shared meaning

themes.scientific_basis: Derived from family systems theory and research on managing religious traditions in relationships
themes.description: Examines how couples handle religious family traditions, expectations, and potential pressures from extended family

themes.scientific_basis: Based on lifecycle research and studies on religious decision-making in relationships
themes.description: Evaluates how partners discuss and plan for future religious decisions, including potential children's religious upbringing

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in identity theory and research on maintaining religious identity in relationships
themes.description: Assesses how couples support each other's religious identity while building a shared relationship identity

themes.scientific_basis: Based on spiritual development research and studies on supporting partner's religious journey
themes.description: Measures how partners support each other's spiritual growth and religious exploration, even when paths differ

themes.scientific_basis: Derived from conflict management research specific to religious differences in relationships
themes.description: Evaluates how couples handle conflicts arising from religious differences, including ability to find constructive solutions

themes.scientific_basis: Based on social network theory and research on managing religious community relationships
themes.description: Assesses how couples navigate relationships with different religious communities and build inclusive social networks

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in research on religious transitions and relationship adaptation
themes.description: Examines how couples handle changes in religious beliefs or practice over time, including maintaining relationship stability during spiritual transitions
